dublin_core.dcvalue: In response to an extended user needs analysis a home telecare system designed for the management of patients with chronic disease was adapted for use in residential aged care facilities RACFs The system architecture and hardware and software components are described for both the client and server side The client side includes medication dispensing scheduled clinical measurements and questionnaire delivery The server side supports Web based administrative tools for scheduling and medications management as well as automated reporting functions A brief discussion on a trial of the system in five different RACFs focuses on how clinical information technology can support and improve care standards and deliver better health outcomes for residents in Australian aged care homes
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:19:49Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-10-23
Conference proceedings : ... Annual International Conference of the IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society. Annual Conference
A clinical monitoring and management system for residential aged care facilities.
